alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Plymouth, southeastern Bristol and eastern Newport Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fairhaven, or near New Bedford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... New Bedford, Fall River, Dartmouth, Marion, Wareham, Somerset, Fairhaven, Tiverton, Westport, Lakeville, Acushnet, Freetown, Berkley, Mattapoisett, Rochester, and Little Compton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Western Plymouth
